quest.name: Saw That One Coming
journal: Eral has noticed a rare bit of excitement within the serene city–state and would share with you what he knows.

Eral has espied a lovely maid frolicking in the Acorn Orchard, and would have you discover whether a feast is nigh. Head off toward the play area outside the Carpenters' Guild to see what so pleases the fair Yedythe.

Yedythe proves to be a dancing master, albeit a rather agitated one at the moment. The younglings under her instruction have fled for more congenial pursuits. Yedythe wonders if Timbermaster Beatin may be of assistance in tracking them down.
Beatin's solution is deceptively simple: a toy for each child. Using the skills that won you acclaim as a tracker, find the truant younglings and present them with the toys.
The younglings see the toys through the lens of their hopes, and return to the orchard resolved to give their nervous dance instructor another try. Return to Yedythe and tell her of what transpired.

Yedythe is delighted to realize that she and the younglings have formed a tentative bond. She teaches you the harvest dance, and is impressed at your talent for it. However, before her plaudits can continue, Beatin appears and inadvertently scares off the poor instructor.
objectives: Give the toys to the children.

dialogue.name: ERAL
dialogue.text: I make no secret about my disinclination toward Gridanians, as you may know. But I just saw a rare sight that I would be remiss not to share with a fellow adventurer.

dialogue.name: ERAL
dialogue.text: Just over yonder in the Acorn Orchard, I saw a comely maiden─new to these benighted parts, I'd wager─dancing with a gaggle of younglings! 'Twas a dance I'd not seen before, and I've seen my fair share.

dialogue.name: ERAL
dialogue.text: Do they perhaps ready themselves for some fresh rite? After so much doom and gloom, I shouldn't mind a day of merrymaking! Ah, just the thought excites me. Would you see what it's all about?

dialogue.name: YEADYTHE
dialogue.text: A day of merrymaking? Is that all you adventurers think about?

dialogue.name: YEADYTHE
dialogue.text: I am here to teach, my dear ladyfellow. From me, these younglings are to learn a most sacred, meaningful, and uniquely uplifting dance.

dialogue.name: YEADYTHE
dialogue.text: Now, I realize full well that tradition may not hold much allure for the young, but I didn't think they would up and run away!

dialogue.name: YEADYTHE
dialogue.text: This manner of disobedience is unprecedented. It's all the more surprising considering they obey the timbermaster without demur.

dialogue.name: YEADYTHE
dialogue.text: What I wouldn't give to know his secrets, but I must wait here for my unruly charges. I wonder, though...might you ask the man how he tamed them?

dialogue.name: YEADYTHE
dialogue.text: How is it that Timbermaster Beatin can get the children to obey him?

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: I do not recall summoning you, Forename. Is there something you wish me to inspect?

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: Another green adventurer come to play with saws?

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: ...Apparently not. Speak your mind, child.

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: So the younglings will not heed their dancing master, and I am to provide the solution. <sigh>

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: Master Yedythe seems able enough, but having no generosity towards herself, she has none for her charges. Give the younglings these on her behalf, and bid them return to their lesson.

dialogue.name: BOY01425
dialogue.text: I ran off because it's boring. All Mistress Yedythe says is how we're doing it wrong!

dialogue.name: BOY01425
dialogue.text: Hey, that's one of Master Beatin's! If this is supposed to be a bribe...then you've got yourself a deal, adventuring ladyman!

dialogue.name: GIRL01425
dialogue.text: But I don't want to be a dancer. Why can't we just play? I mean, I guess we could dance for fun, but...I don't think Mistress Yedythe knows how! She's so uptight.

dialogue.name: GIRL01425
dialogue.text: Is this one of Master Beatin's toys? Does this mean there's more if I go back to class!? I'm on my way!

dialogue.name: BOY201425
dialogue.text: Ummm...scoop with both hands, then look left, up, up, right, down... Or is it up, up, down, down, left, right, left, right? I wish she would let me take notes...

dialogue.name: BOY201425
dialogue.text: Oh! Why, this is made of maple... It's unmistakable! Hah, Master Beatin would tell you the grain of it almost flows...like syrup. Someday, I'll be a timbermaster like him!

dialogue.name: BOY201425
dialogue.text: ...He wants me to go back to Mistress Yedythe's class, doesn't he? <sigh> He always tells us that if you can true a piece of wood, there's no excuse for not truing yourself... All right, I'm going.

dialogue.name: YEADYTHE
dialogue.text: Well, I don't know what sorcery you worked, but the younglings are back...and I do believe we've reached an accommodation! 'Twould seem I was stricter than I imagined...and loosening up a bit has made a great difference!

dialogue.name: YEADYTHE
dialogue.text: This dance is for the Feast of the Harvest, to give thanks to Nophica and the elementals. There must be no aggression in this dance, lest the Matron be angered. It's very, very important!

dialogue.name: YEADYTHE
dialogue.text: I do realize I haven't made the best first impression, having you fetch my students for me. To make it up to you, will you let me show you the dance? Think of it as a kind of...peace offering!

dialogue.name: YEADYTHE
dialogue.text: Why, you are a born dancer, dear ladysir!

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text:
(-Sonorous Voice-)And so say weee,♪
And so say weee...♪

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text:
Comes a sailor from the sea,♪
To show the laddies how it's done,♪
And so say weee,♪
And so say weee...♪

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text:
Swings his axe and says remember,♪
Shiver, shiver me timbers.♪
And so say weee,♪
And so say weee...♪

dialogue.name: YEADYTHE
dialogue.text: Oh... Oh, gods, nooo! Master Beatin, what have you done!? You've brought a weapon to the sacred dance! The Matron forgive us, we are surely doomed!

dialogue.name: BOY01425
dialogue.text: Master Beatin! You scared her off! We were having fun!

dialogue.name: BOY201425
dialogue.text: Timbermaster Beatin, wasn't that a sailor's song? How do you know it?

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: I... Never mind how I know. More to the point, what could have troubled Mistress Yedythe so?

dialogue.name: GIRL01425
dialogue.text: You did! She said you're supposed to be peaceful or the elementals will be upset! And you know how uptight she gets...

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: The course of relationships never does run smooth, child. You will all discover this in time.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have learned the emote Harvest Dance!
